data: It had been a hard winter along the slopes of the Great Smoky Mountains, and still the towering treeless domes were covered with snow, and the vagrant winds were abroad, rioting among the clifty heights where they held their tryst, or raiding down into the sheltered depths of the Cove, where they seldom intruded.
slopes of the Great Smoky Mountains | clifty heights | sheltered depths of the Cove

It had been a hard winter along the slopes of the Great Smoky Mountains, and still the towering treeless domes were covered with snow, and the vagrant winds were abroad, rioting among the clifty heights where they held their tryst, or raiding down into the sheltered depths of the Cove, where they seldom intruded.
Craddock, Charles Egbert, 1850-1922; Frost, A. B. (Arthur Burdett), 1851-1928 [Illustrator]
